result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Joseph Szarkowitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration & is Eligible for the Substance Abuse programs
AODA assessment and treatment w/any necessary followup

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan Joseph Szarkowitz

records.addlTxt: from deft to terminate Probation early.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: DNA sample unless already done.  Statement of negotiated plea.

Defendant Ryan Joseph Szarkowitz in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Deft enters a plea of no contest to Count 1, Count 2 - DRI   Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.

Court orders
3 years initial conf,  5 years extended supervision - concurrent to 11F151 - Oneida County case
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court. - 30 of release from prison to setup a payment plan
AODA assessment and treatment w/any necessary followup
DL revoked for 36 months
Pursuant to the provisions of Section 343.301, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the Court orders that for a period of _36_ months, each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration be equipped with an ignition interlock device.

Also, pursuant to the provisions of Section 343.301, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the Court further orders that for a period of _36__ months, beginning on the date the Department of Transportation issues any license to the defendant granted under Ch. 343, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the defendant's operating privileges for the operation of Class D vehicles be restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device.

Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration & Is eligible for the Substance Abuse programs

51 days sentence credit
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on April 7, 2016 at 08:55 am.

Defendant Ryan Joseph Szarkowitz in court, in custody with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called appearances given.  Defense is going to waive the PH - FVI  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 08:55 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 23, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Ryan Joseph Szarkowitz in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Court addresses the deft as to where his attorney is at, deft responses by informing the court as to the status of a public defender.  Court addresses that the time limits were not waived for preliminary hearing.  Court informs the deft what is involued with a preliminary hearing.  Deft decides to waive the time limits.  Court to reset.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Shall not consume or possess alcoholic beverages or go on tavern/bar premises  Not operate a motor vehicle

Defendant Ryan Joseph Szarkowitz in court, in custody.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Complaint read to the deft.  Attorney rights advised.  Time limits for the preliminary hearing are not waived. Bond set  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
